required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy, Safety, Tolerability And Actual Use Study Of Bococizumab And An Autoinjector (Pre-Filled Pen) In Subjects With Hyperlipidemia Or Dyslipidemia
clinical_study.official_title: A 12 Week, Phase 3, Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Parallel Group Study To Assess The Efficacy, Safety, Tolerability And Actual Use Of Bococizumab And An Autoinjector (Pre-filled Pen) In Subjects With Primary Hyperlipidemia Or Mixed Dyslipidemia

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a multicenter, randomized study in subjects with high cholesterol receiving statins to assess the efficacy to lower LDL-C, the safety, tolerability and actual use of bococizumab and an autoinjector (pre-filled pen).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline at Week 12 in Fasting Low Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C) Level for Bococizumab 150 mg Dose Group and Matched Placebo
Percentage of Injections That Met the Definition for Successful Assessment Using the Participant Assessment Tool (PAT) for Bococizumab 150 mg Dose Group at Week 0 (Day 1)
primary_outcome.description: A successful injection based on PAT was an injection where the participant answered "yes" to all the three questions: "Were you able to inject your medicine?" "Has the blue bar moved across the window?" Was the medicine not flowing after needle withdrawn?"

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Injections That Met the Definition for Successful Assessment Using the Participant Assessment Tool (PAT) for Bococizumab 150 mg Dose Group at Week 2
primary_outcome.description: A successful injection based on PAT was an injection where the participant answered "yes" to all the three questions: "Were you able to inject your medicine?" "Has the blue bar moved across the window?" Was the medicine not flowing after needle withdrawn?"

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Injections That Met the Definition for Successful Assessment Using the Participant Assessment Tool (PAT) for Bococizumab 150 mg Dose Group at Week 4
primary_outcome.description: A successful injection based on PAT was an injection where the participant answered "yes" to all the three questions: "Were you able to inject your medicine?" "Has the blue bar moved across the window?" Was the medicine not flowing after needle withdrawn?"

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Injections That Met the Definition for Successful Assessment Using the Participant Assessment Tool (PAT) for Bococizumab 150 mg Dose Group at Week 6
primary_outcome.description: A successful injection based on PAT was an injection where the participant answered "yes" to all the three questions: "Were you able to inject your medicine?" "Has the blue bar moved across the window?" Was the medicine not flowing after needle withdrawn?"

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Injections That Met the Definition for Successful Assessment Using the Participant Assessment Tool (PAT) for Bococizumab 150 mg Dose Group at Week 8
primary_outcome.description: A successful injection based on PAT was an injection where the participant answered "yes" to all the three questions: "Were you able to inject your medicine?" "Has the blue bar moved across the window?" Was the medicine not flowing after needle withdrawn?"

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Injections That Met the Definition for Successful Assessment Using the Participant Assessment Tool (PAT) for Bococizumab 150 mg Dose Group at Week 10
primary_outcome.description: A successful injection based on PAT was an injection where the participant answered "yes" to all the three questions: "Were you able to inject your medicine?" "Has the blue bar moved across the window?" Was the medicine not flowing after needle withdrawn?"

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Injections That Met the Definition for Successful Assessment Using the Participant Assessment Tool (PAT) for Bococizumab 75 mg Dose Group and Combined Bococizumab 150 mg and 75 mg Dose Group at Week 0 (Day 1), 2, 4, 6, 8 and 10
secondary_outcome.description: A successful injection based on PAT was an injection where the participant answered "yes" to all the three questions: "Were you able to inject your medicine?" "Has the blue bar moved across the window?" Was the medicine not flowing after needle withdrawn?"

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Injections That Met the Definition for Successful Assessment Using the Observer Assessment Tool (OAT) for Bococizumab 150 mg Dose, Bococizumab 75 mg Dose Group and Combined Bococizumab 150 mg and 75 mg Dose Group at Week 0 (Day 1), 4 and 8
secondary_outcome.description: As per the OAT, a 'successful' injection was based on observer's response for the question - "Was the administration successful?''. Observer's response being 'Yes' corresponded to a successful injection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline at Week 12 in Fasting Low Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C) Level for Bococizumab 75 mg Dose Group and Matched Placebo
Percent Change From Baseline in Fasting Total Cholesterol (TC) at Week 12
Percent Change From Baseline in Apolipoprotein B (ApoB) at Week 12
Percent Change From Baseline in Fasting Non- High Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (Non HDL-C) at Week 12
Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; Initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent were events between first dose of study drug up to the follow up visit (up to 18 weeks), that were absent before treatment or that worsened relative to pretreatment state. AEs included both SAEs and non-SAEs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Anti-Drug Antibodies (ADA) and Neutralizing Antibodies (nAb)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with at least 1 positive ADA titer or 1 positive nAb titer were reported. Participants with their ADA titer levels >=6.23 were considered as ADA positive and participants with their nAb titer level >=1.58 were considered as nAb positive.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentration of Bococizumab at Week 12
Plasma Concentration of Proprotein Convertase Subtilisin Kexin Type 9 (PCSK9) at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: PCSK9 is an enzyme encoded by the PCSK9 gene in humans on chromosome. It is the 9th member of the proprotein convertase family of proteins that activate other proteins.

intervention.description: Bococizumab autoinjector (pre-filled pen) combination Product. 150mg every 2 weeks for 10 weeks, subcutaneous injection.
Bococizumab autoinjector (pre-filled pen) combination Product. 75mg every 2 weeks for 10 weeks, subcutaneous injection.
Bococizumab placebo autoinjector (pre-filled pen) combination Product. 150mg placebo every 2 weeks for 10 weeks, subcutaneous injection.
Bococizumab placebo autoinjector (pre-filled pen) combination product. 75mg placebo every 2 weeks for 10 weeks, subcutaneous injection.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Treated with a statin - Fasting LDL-C >=70mg/dL and triglycerides <=400mg/dL
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or breastfeeding females - Cardiovascular or cerebrovascular event or procedures during the past 90 days - Congestive heart failure NYHA class IV - Poorly controlled hypertension

facility.name: Texas Center for Drug Development, Inc.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Placebo Matched to Bococizumab 150 mg
group.description: Participants received single dose of placebo matched to bococizumab 150 milligram (mg) subcutaneous injection once in every 2 weeks over a period of 12 weeks. Participants were followed up to 18 weeks.

group.title: Bococizumab 150 mg
group.description: Participants received single dose of bococizumab 150 mg subcutaneous injection once in every 2 weeks, over a period of 12 weeks. Participants were followed up to 18 weeks.

group.description: Participants received single dose of placebo matched to bococizumab 75 mg subcutaneous injection once in every 2 weeks, over a period of 12 weeks. Participants were followed up to 18 weeks.

group.title: Bococizumab 75 mg
group.description: Participants received single dose of bococizumab 75 mg subcutaneous injection once in every 2 weeks, over a period of 12 weeks. Participants were followed up to 18 weeks.

analysis.groups_desc: LS-mean difference, associated 95% confidence intervals, and p-value are from MMRM model with fixed effects for treatment groups, visit, treatment group*visit interaction, baseline value, baseline value*visit interaction as covariates.

outcome.title: Percentage of Injections That Met the Definition for Successful Assessment Using the Participant Assessment Tool (PAT) for Bococizumab 150 mg Dose Group at Week 0 (Day 1)
outcome.description: A successful injection based on PAT was an injection where the participant answered “yes” to all the three questions: “Were you able to inject your medicine?” “Has the blue bar moved across the window?” Was the medicine not flowing after needle withdrawn?”
outcome.population: Full analysis set included all participants who were randomized. Data for this outcome measure was not planned to be analyzed for placebo arms, as pre-specified in protocol.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; Initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent were events between first dose of study drug up to the follow up visit (up to 18 weeks), that were absent before treatment or that worsened relative to pretreatment state. AEs included both SAEs and non-SAEs.
outcome.population: Safety analysis set included all participants who received at least one dose of study medication.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
measure.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; Initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent were events between first dose of study drug up to the follow up visit (up to 18 weeks), that were absent before treatment or that worsened relative to pretreatment state. AEs included both SAEs and non-SAEs.
measure.population: Safety analysis set included all participants who received at least one dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Anti-Drug Antibodies (ADA) and Neutralizing Antibodies (nAb)
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with at least 1 positive ADA titer or 1 positive nAb titer were reported. Participants with their ADA titer levels >=6.23 were considered as ADA positive and participants with their nAb titer level >=1.58 were considered as nAb positive.
outcome.population: Safety analysis set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study treatment. Participants who received at least 1 dose of bococizumab were evaluable for this outcome measure. Here, 'number of participants analyzed' signifies those participants who were evaluable for this outcome measure.

group.description: Participants received single dose of bococizumab 150 mg subcutaneous injection once in every 2 weeks, over a period of 12 weeks. Participants were followed up to 18 weeks.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Anti-Drug Antibodies (ADA) and Neutralizing Antibodies (nAb)
measure.description: Percentage of participants with at least 1 positive ADA titer or 1 positive nAb titer were reported. Participants with their ADA titer levels >=6.23 were considered as ADA positive and participants with their nAb titer level >=1.58 were considered as nAb positive.
measure.population: Safety analysis set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study treatment. Participants who received at least 1 dose of bococizumab were evaluable for this outcome measure. Here, 'number of participants analyzed' signifies those participants who were evaluable for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Plasma Concentration of Bococizumab at Week 12
outcome.population: Analysis set included all participants who received at least one dose of study medication. Participants who received at least 1 dose of Bococizumab were evaluable for this outcome measure. Here, 'number of participants analyzed' signifies those participants who were evaluable for this outcome measure.

group.title: Bococizumab 150 mg
group.description: Participants received single dose of bococizumab 150 mg subcutaneous injection once in every 2 weeks, over a period of 12 weeks. Participants were followed up to 18 weeks.

group.title: Bococizumab 75 mg
group.description: Participants received single dose of bococizumab 75 mg subcutaneous injection once in every 2 weeks, over a period of 12 weeks. Participants were followed up to 18 weeks.

measure.title: Plasma Concentration of Bococizumab at Week 12
measure.population: Analysis set included all participants who received at least one dose of study medication. Participants who received at least 1 dose of Bococizumab were evaluable for this outcome measure. outcome.title: Plasma Concentration of Proprotein Convertase Subtilisin Kexin Type 9 (PCSK9) at Week 12
outcome.description: PCSK9 is an enzyme encoded by the PCSK9 gene in humans on chromosome. It is the 9th member of the proprotein convertase family of proteins that activate other proteins.
outcome.population: Safety analysis set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study treatment. Here, 'number of participants analyzed' signifies those participants who were evaluable for this outcome measure.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one participant and as nonserious in another participant, or one participant may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
